intro: Grumilea sylvatica, commonly known as the forest grumilea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate forests of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Grumilea sylvatica thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a suitable addition to woodland gardens.
